text: How about when the status of the line item is changed and I need a date picker?
Can I create this automation?
There's the OpenAPI endpoint that returns a list of endpoints and the endpoint specs
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/get-all-publicly-available-open-api-specifications>
But really the api docs are pretty full (legacy and new) so you should be able to find everything you need
Sure you could create a workflow for that but line items don't typically have statuses
I think you might be talking about the deal

Hello everyone
I use a client secret (token) while developing my listed app, and I've lately added new scopes (deals read and write) in the "Auth Settings" page.
For some unknown reason, the client token is not updated with the newly added scopes and I am not permitted to do any operation on deals.
I tried to log out and log in, but it didn't help.

I get the following message:
`"HTTP-Code: 403\nMessage: An error occurred.\nBody: {\"status\":\"error\",\"message\":\"This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>.\`

I wonder what's the correct way to refresh the client secret, because I could not find any reference for such a thing,
Of course that if I am using a personal token, the app works as expected and I am able to perform deal operations!
Thanks...
okay, thank you!
You need to re install the app on the account to get it to take the new scopes
This is built this way so that a dev can't build an account with just the contact scope, get everyone to install the app, and then just take over complete control of the account
of course
thanks!

I can't find the endpoint (and associated parameters) to create a calculated property based on count() or max() of an association. I can do it in the GUI, but when I inspect the property through the API, it doesn't give me enough information to be able to recreate it through an endpoint.
Let me try and create it real quick
Yeah it's interesting, in the UI it's called a rollup field but in the docs there is no rollup field option
still testing
that's one of the things that tripped me up. when i passed calculation_rollup to the property create API, it told me that wasn't a valid enumeration
the other was that the formula and associated object were both missing from the inspection of the property
yep it's probably association.deal for example though if you're trying to access associated object info (for the deal in this case)
i've got 5 calculated properties to add across two different custom objects
Yeah completely understand
the inspection didn't show those two parameters from the GUI-created one. that's why i was wondering about the list of endpoints.
Well yeah it wouldn't be a different endpoint
Thanks for that list! I'll be able to create a reference doc that is usable on my phone
Of course, and I'm still testing a couple of different things on my end
<@U01QVR44MEY> What do you mean by reinstalling? Trying to fix my problem now, and since this is an app created by me I only see "delete app" button, which is, of course, not what I intend to do
i thought maybe there's a secret v4 version of the endpoint, or something similar :-)

```{"property":{"portalId":21496839,"name":"test1","label":"test1","type":"number","fieldType":"calculation_rollup","description":"","groupName":"children","options":[],"readOnlyValue":true,"calculated":true,"externalOptions":false,"updatedAt":1676561383653,"createdAt":1676561299451,"allowedObjectTypes":[]},"rollupExpression":{"sourceObjectTypeId":"0-3","sourcePropertyName":"amount","sourceCompareByPropertyName":null,"rollupOperator":"SUM","associationTypes":
[{"associationCategory":"HubSpot_DEFINED","associationTypeId":3}],"conditionalExpression":null,"conditionalFormula":null,"emptyRollupValue":null},"objectTypeId":"0-1"}```
That's how HubSpot creates it on their end
There is a V4 endpoint :exploding_head:
Yeah so on the account that you install the app on
not the account where you built the app
I guess my tin foil hat came in handy this time :-)
Currently accessible by just the HubSpot ui
oh...yay :-)
Yeah kinda unfortunate
the good news is that I won't have to code these properties now. the bad news is that I have to document how to create them via the GUI for my client :-)
Thanks for the detective work, Carter  !
of course man, still trying to hack my way around it
I'll let you know I can get it
awesome, thanks!
thank you!!!
for sure
It is not a private app though. I am using the client secret from the app's "Auth Settings" page, and it's on the same account that registered the app to the marketplace

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth>
used this guide
Yes I completely understand that
I'm missing something
You still need to reinstall the app on the portal you want to use it on
You don't need to delete/rebuild the app you just need to use the install url and pick the same portal you're trying to use it with
that will update the scopes
Ok so if I understand correctly, this i've already tried, but with no success
You need to specify scopes that are limited to higher up tiers in the optional scopes parameter
from the docs:

Ok, the problem was with my private app token and nothing to do with the client secret. I had to go to the account > integrations > private apps and then rotate the existing token / create a new private app. Thank you very much for your time it definitely helped me understand I was looking at the wrong place.
You're totally good, no problem at all
Hi everyone :wave: Is there a way for me to get the number of *marketing* contacts in our account, as well as our contact limit using the API?

The closest I've come is the `<https://app.HubSpot.com/api/account-and-billing/v1/marketable-contacts/count/><ID>` route that the billing page uses, but it seems to require a cookie instead of an API token.
Oh I see you, digging around in the network tab can definitely appreciate that
You can use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search> api and filter where the contact status is marketing contact
for the limits it depends on what account you have but you can find that out using the account info api
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api>
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>! I managed to get the number of marketing contacts now :tada:

For the limit, are you suggesting to check the `accountType` and then assume that the limit is equal to that account's type? Or do you mean that for some account types, you can get the limit from that API route?
You can check the api usage limit and then use that to figure out the which tier you're on
this won't include things like marketing contacts upgrade packages though
just the base level info
of course

Hey all, I’m trying to get the following data from the CRM API in a request - the most recently modified deals, excluding those that are closed (in default “Sales Pipeline” or any other pipeline)

I have the ids of all the custom pipelines and I’ve tried POSTing to `crm/v3/objects/deals/search`, passing `filters` array with `{ "value": "<CLOSED_STAGE_ID>", "propertyName": "dealstage", "operator": "NEQ" }` - but the API only allows me to send 3 at a time.

Is this possible with this endpoint or any other?

Thanks!
Can you share your full request body?
In most cases like this you'll want to use the values array instead of just one value at a time
Yep so let me just edit this real quick
awesome - thanks so much!
of course

also, in working with the deals in the API, in trying to figure out the available default properties I’m looking at this list here: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-deals/HubSpots-default-deal-properties?_ga=2.195561004.1286217982.1676316773-724507486.1668616011>

is this the right place to look? or is there some place that shows the properties in the format that they’re represented in in the API? e.g. `dealname` and `dealstage` instead of just `name` and `stage`
You can use the properties api to pull in the properties but honestly that list is pretty easy to figure out the property names
you can also use the properties editor in the HubSpot UI and clicking on the </> symbol will bring up the internal name
great, thanks again!
of course
<@U03MLCLS5BN> Are there Advance Video API docs in the works? Can you hook me up? I've been trying to get some questions answered for weeks!

The thread says it’s a read only field.

You could create another property as a checkbox type, set that value via api, then create a workflow to set contact marketing status based on that newly created property.
